title: Anyone else find overcharge as a let down?
body: Very limiting with what marksman champs we can play and even then some of the options suck like hell, of course with vayne being bullcrap as ever by being one of THE BEST picks.

replies.body: Its like bloodmoon with right clicking only. kiting is nonexistent because everyone is ranged so its just stat-sticking

To be fair, you rarely ever kite in bloodmoon because usually if a fight starts someone dies in 0,5 seconds. 

But yah, this mode is also largely about who oneshots the other faster.

I did not have much fun playing it, but that is probably due to the champion and summoner restrictions and lack of runes.

The music, the map, the vision zones, even somewhat the jump zones, I thought there well done and interesting.

Basically I dislike it for the exact same reason I dislike blood moon. You are forced to play it a certain way, even if it might be fun to play it differently.

... Yeah, the more URF I play, the more I dislike it. Makes you appreciate how balanced the real game actually is.

That's because you're brainwashed into thinking balance = most fun. I like URF and One For All BECAUSE there is no balance based around it. It's a nice break from the stressful rage fest of 5's ranked, where meta picks and tilted allies suck the fun out of it. 

It's actually nice to have some 'fuck around' fun without having to dial up a different game when ranked has me bored or emotionally drained to the point that my body is tired. Riot wants you to think that LC$ Simulator is the ultimate 'fun' experience, but I'm happier than shit when URF rolls around, and I can say "fuck the balance" to roll my face through some crazy games with rl friends and nothing on the line. 

Because Riot has everyone believing that ranked SR balance is the ultimate fun, TT will finally breathe it's last breath soon and One For All will probably go another year with shit excuses about the new client.

Brainwashed? No... URF is a mode where 20 champs are good and whoever gets the most of that pool wins.

You can't _"Fuck Around"_... try playing something fun like AD Syndra, and you'll be playing at a disadvantage. Next time you're at an URF game and your team's losing 2 - 18, remember how _"fun"_ you claim the mode to be.

One For all, that's fine.

Okay, so "only 20 good champs" and "when you're losing 2-18"? That sounds like ranked SR right now, which you praised for it's amazing balance. Yes, some champions are better than others in every game mode, so what's your point again? I've won games of URF with inferior champions. A team full of Poppy/Skarner/Voli/etc aren't winning shit in ranked, but they can win an URF game. You're a ranked meta slave, so if you don't see a traditional ADC/support bot, you deem it unbalanced and unfun.

There are more than 20 good champs in URF, and getting stomped in a custom game carries no stress. My idea of fun isn't playing AD Syndra in any mode, so I don't even know where you're trying lure me with this one.

Fast paced 5v5 game modes that don't make sense are a breath of fresh air when you've been smashing SR for 8 years. If you don't like them, then no one is stopping you from playing ranked SR.

Why are you still here???

It's another 'one and done' game mode, like the Thresh game, Nexus Siege, and all of the pve stuff. We see a saturation of the one and dones because it gets us back to playing LC$ Simulator(5v5 SR). 

When URF, One For All, or Hexakill come around, I see friends that I haven't seen since last time they were up, rl friends send texts letting me know it's coming, and my friends list is active as fuck. Defend the shitter modes as much as you'd like, but no one is sending texts for Poros, Blood Moon, or pve side projects. I'd like to see some SC2 style Arcade Mode, where everything is always available and the customers get to choose what and when they play, instead of being forced into RGMs like monkeys.
